title.rendered: Air Ducts Cleaning: Are Toxic Chemicals Used When Cleaning and is It Safe for My Family?

content.rendered:
A lot of homeowners ignore their air ducts cleaning because it simply doesn’t seem much important. What they don’t realize is, having dirty air ducts can contaminate their indoor air quality and cause allergies, nasal congestion, and various other health issues.

Thankfully, as technology is advancing and people are growing more conscious about their health, air ducts cleaning has emerged as one of the most important home services that help you stay healthy.

If you or someone in your home is suffering from asthma, allergies, irritation of eyes, or other respiratory issues, consider hiring an air duct cleaning company to get your ductwork cleaned.

It’s recommended to clean your air ducts every 3-6 months, depending on how much you use your HVAC system. This gets rid of pollutants and toxins like mold, dirt, dust, and bacteria that grow inside the HVAC system over time.

There are 3 key signs that your air ducts need to be cleaned by a professional:

  •       The air ducts are clogged with dirt and debris
  •       The air ducts have become infested with insects and pests
  •       Mold and/or mildew has started growing inside the air ducts

If you notice any of these signs, call an air duct cleaning installation company right away, or you’d risk exposing yourself to harmful pollutants. 

Why Air Duct Cleaning is Crucial For the Wellbeing of Your Family

Dirty air ducts can adversely affect your health in several ways. The cleaning of air ducts doesn’t just increase the lifespan of the HVAC system but also improves the quality of your life:

Clean air ducts increase the cleanliness of your home: You can protect yourself from some serious health issues by simply keeping your air ducts clean. Studies have shown that patients suffering from pulmonary health issues experienced a reduction in their symptoms when their home’s air ducts were cleaned on a frequent basis.

Regular cleaning can help reduce allergies and asthma: When you consistently breathe in polluted air, you are bound to develop allergies, asthma, and frequent cold. This is especially true if the occupants of the house include the elderly and kids.

By cleaning your air ducts every couple of months, you’d reduce the circulation of bacteria and viruses in the air. If you are constantly suffering from a cold or you are expecting a newborn (who are more sensitive than adults), it is imperative that you schedule regular cleanings.

Clean air ducts keep you happy: Do you feel tired or sluggish but can’t figure out why? It could be because you are breathing in contaminated air blowing in from clogged up air ducts. Living in a polluted indoor environment can make you lethargic as well as depressed.

Regular air ducts cleaning improves the functioning of HVAC Systems: Debris and dirt buildup inside the air ducts prevent the system from working at its full efficiency. This means your HVAC system will be forced to work harder but still give a mediocre performance.

It will no longer filter the air efficiently, in fact, it will increase your utility bills.

Schedule An Air Ducts Cleaning Appointment Today

If you think your HVAC system is not working at peak efficiency or it is contributing to your health issues, it’s time to call in the professionals. For best results, you should change your air filters every 2 months and clean your air ducts every 3-5 months.

At United Home Services, our standard maintenance package includes cleaning the air ducts, air filter, and the entire AC unit, among other things.

Call us toll-free at 800-399-4248 or complete our online contact form to get in touch with us!
